p: Feline parvovirus (FPV), currently classified within the species Carnivore protoparvovirus 1 ( Protoparvovirus genus), causes feline panleukopenia, the oldest known viral disease of cats [ 1], characterized by severe panleukopenia and enteritis in cats [ 2, 3] and cerebellar ataxia in kittens [ 95]. Infection is highly contagious, often associated with high mortality and morbidity [ 96].
